intro: Selinum dioscoridis, commonly known as greater celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of large, heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, including alkaloids and flavonoids, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
